messages.subject: Inuyasha
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/23/03 9:43:49 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/23/03 9:43:49 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< OK! I know of Adult Swim although I rarely make it that late. I would fall
asleep about ten but then I'd miss Samurai jack so I fall asleep around
10:31.
Now that's a great cartoon! >>

Ooh, I forgot about Samurai Jack, we watched that last night!!
I LOVE the song "Gotta do that, back to the past, Samurai Jack"...cool.
He learned how to jump really, really high from these furry, fat forest
creatures that didn't know how to defend themselves.
Jack took care of business boy howdy!

Ren
"The world's much smaller than you think. Made up of two kinds of
people--simple and complicated.....The simple ones are contented. The
complicated ones aren't."
"Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com

messages.subject: Inuyasha
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/23/03 11:14:08 AM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:  It s a Japanese Anime
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/23/03 11:14:08 AM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Hey Ren,
What is this? >>

It's a Japanese Anime show, on the "Adult Swim" program.....which is on the
Cartoon Network later at night.
Adult Swim is one of those programs with the warnings up front about
violence, rude behavior and language etc...
We love it!! hehe
InuYasha is fairly tame...it's about a 1/2 demon 1/2 human and a girl that is
a reincarnation of a demon slayer. They go about slaying demons and having
adventures, it's somewhat dark at times, very mystical/supernatural and
interesting. I love Inuyasha's long, white hair. He's decidedly immature at
times though.
Some other programs from Adult Swim are "Home Movies", "The Brack Show"
(totally hilarious if you like warped humor), "Space Ghost" (which has real
live celebrities being interviewed by a cartoon character "Cowboy Bebop"
(another Japanese anime).
The thing they all have in common is the crass humor and/or dark themes.
Oh, and "YuYu Hakasho" is another anime during that time.

Ren
"The world's much smaller than you think. Made up of two kinds of
people--simple and complicated.....The simple ones are contented. The
complicated ones aren't."
"Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
